intro: Castilleja minor subsp. spiralis, commonly known as the spiral castilleja, is a hemiparasitic plant that belongs to the Orobanchaceae family. It is characterized by its bright red to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands, often in the western United States. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The subspecies is distinguished by its spiral arrangement of flowers along the stem, giving it its common name.
